description: APPLICATION TO VARY CONDITION 2 (Approved plans) ATTACHED TO PLANNING CONSENT 20/P1605 Demolition of the existing 2 storey side extension and erection of  a new 2 storey side extension with associated roof works. Erection of a single storey rear extension. Internal alterations to provide ancillary care facilities and carer accommodation.  Erection of new cycle and refuse facilities to the front of the site. External works to include new fenestration, new materials finish, new disabled access ramp and PV panels to the roof slope.  CHANGES INVOLVE 1. Install x2 number rooflights to existing south roof pitch, between existing chimney stacks.2.Entrance porch: brick faced cladding over concrete projecting lip and white finished cladding Applied to exposed concrete ceiling.3.North side, rebuilt two story extension: eaves level raised by 150 mm (remaining subsidiary eaves level to existing main roof.) 4.Rear part of roof to north side, two story extension: hipped roof valley junction to main roof revised to an extended roof plane junction. The roof height to remain as consented and appearance to remain subsidiary to the existing main roof.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of planning permission 20/P1605.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site location plan and drawings AP/1.01 Rev A, 02, 03, 04, 05 Rev A, AP/2.01 Rev A, 02 Rev A, 03 Rev A, 04 Rev A, AP/3.01 Rev A & 02
Condition : 3 - The works hereby approved shall be undertaken fully in accordance with those conditions applied to Planning Permission 20/P1605. Reason, in the interest of proper planning.

Condition : 4 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i)  The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
